title: Crazy Idea for Assassins.
body:
Well it's pretty well known that assassins need help.

They can't burst through the ADC's lifesteal and the shields that get thrown on them and Exhaust. Basically their only job is really hard.

So here's a crazy idea. 

Give Assassins lethality items that inflict Grievous Wounds OR

Give Assassins lethality items that disable shields on their target. 

Discuss. If these are both stupid ideas and you have a better idea then please suggest it.

replies.body: These items will just end up being abused by other roles. Assassins will always be shit until Riot realizes that they actually should be allowed to do their job. Why pick an assassin when you can build those items on an ADC or some fighters like Jayce so you either attack from safe range instead of diving into their entire enemy team or can build tanky to actually be able to survive.

Assassins will always be shit if their job is revolved around killing players and offering nothing else if they can't do that. 

A little push towards some better objective secure could work I think.

Inb4 Zed starts ulting turrets and dragons and kills them with full conboes.

It's brilliant!
I would like to see that tbh.

I can see that breaking every other patch to give Zed % of dragon's or baron's AD tbh.

But cool idea otherwise.

Didn't Riot say that with the assassin update they were going to introduce an objective for assassins anyway?
I mean...I could see Zed ulting dragon or Baron.
It would be pretty cool, and give him something to do besides endlessly splitpush.
That did happen before, {{champion:245}} 'assassin' with utility, and look how people ended up building him

The main issue is ADCs. Liek you said, other roles abuse items not meant for them, and ADCs are the prime offender of this. Sterak's, frozen mallet, IBG, etc. The solution is to make these assassin items melee only, or make them useless to AD champions by giving them AP stats. This way both AD and AP assassins can get good items, without ADCs abusing them. On top of it, Sterak's IBG, and Mallet should be made melee only as well, andd Sterak's returned to it's pre-nerf stats would help a lot for tanks being able to survive being bursted, but not DPSed assassins and ADCs, while assassins can survive ADCs but not tanks. This way, everyone does their jobs properly.

Hmm. Good point.

A rather brute force way of doing it would be to tie these items to a summoner spell like jungle items are.

As someone who loves Sion's shield, I'm not exactly a fan of "shield penetration" as a stat since it ruins the damage mitigation of tanks that rely on their shields.

it would be an Assassin Item.

Being able to ignore (part of) Sions Shield would still not make it the best Idea for Assassins to attack a Sion.

it's just so you have a counter against shit like {{champion:43}} or {{champion:40}} as an Assassin.

and maybe Riot would actually come to the idea of making specific items _melee only_ when they don't want them abused on ADCs when creating such an item.

Make it like Viktor's Hexcore :' )

Specific items only specific champs can buy.

That would be interesting. If there were specific items that only a specific class could buy. such as assassins have *assassin items* or any role or class for that matter. I would at least be on board with exploring the possibility .
They could probably test it out in an alternative game mode.

But that would still hurt build diversity. 

It'd be easier to balance. I won't lie. But it would cost Riot their precious "diversity in choices"

This is something I feel heroes has over league. Usually the problems are in a character or their ability and nerfing them doesn't negatively impact others.
And their excuse is a crock of shit really. Just feels like if it doesn't benefit ADC's they don't care. If the hydra items weren't melee only we'd see marksman building them too.

Why not add negative effects to an item if it's getting abused by a specific class? 

Take Sterak's, for example. It was getting abused by ADCs, so it got nerfed in a way that also hurt its intended users. Instead, they could have added an additional effect that would only really affect ADCs.

Something like "-20% bonus attack speed" or "-15% crit chance". Most of the intended users of Sterak's don't buy bonus attack speed, and even fewer get crit chance, so those wouldn't affect most of them. But ADCs really like attack speed and crit chance, so purchasing Sterak's would become a bad option unless they _really_ needed it for some reason.

Any intended users who were hit by the debuffs  could receive some compensation.

Other items could get similar changes if they were abused - tailored to the class abusing them with little impact on the intended users. 

That would leave the items open for off-meta or situational builds on some champions without them being overpowered on unintended users.

this has nothing to do with build diversity.
build diversity is being able to adjust your build so you can get the stuff you need against your enemies for example, but still with items that should fit your class.

but when an item is designed in a way that ADCs aren't supposed to build it in the first place, in no situation, that's another thing.

Hydras are melee only too because they would be unbalanced on ADCs.

I believe in Riot's mind that build diversity is the freedom to build any item you want regardless of how it impacts your character. Thus allowing stuff like full AP Malphite. 

The only reason I think hydra is melee only and runaans is ranged only is how much of a headache it'd be to not only code them for melee and ranged, but also how'd they'd interact with each other.

Im not gonna lie I want hydra runnaans jinx in this game.

Just once tho

On the bright side, they wouldn't be able to pop your shield! That 14% max health damage + its flat damage is niiiice.

Besides, I think shield pen would help with CotC abusers, as they have little enough health to be easily killed when they try to cheese with it when the true tanks would have the resists and health to survive.
